author: heinz.gassner
title: DLT360: Machines and the Metaverse
description: Machine & equipment manufacturers are struggling to re-position their business models. Industrial IoT has not brought the expected benefits

f6_assessments.q0:
NOTE for VCAs and voters: This proposal is part of a wider project (DLT360) that has at least 13 proposals in this funding round. This proposal is judged partly through its individual merits, and partly through the way it fits into the wider DLT360 project. My assessment takes into account aspects common across all proposals (team specific like adequacy, competency, workload, or similar reporting mechanisms / budget logic). You shall therefore find common parts across these proposals (labeled as such) and parts specific to each proposal, which should offer a good balance of looking at each tree but not missing out the overall health of the forest. 

Specific part: this proposal is about researching a part of the industrial value-chain: Consumer Packaged Goods industry. The goal is to run a project in close proximity with large vendors and to integrate the findings in form of a Whitepaper.
f6_assessments.q1:
COMMON part: Great team. DLT360 is operated by an outstanding and growing team of regulatory experts, very active in the Cardano community. They also benefit from a scalable network of contributors from the Cardano community, academia, industry and EU institutions. In terms of team competence, skills and experience, they are well positioned.The multitude of projects funded under their umbrella showcases the great capacity to identify opportunities within the Cardano community and clearly articulate them into actionable projects. 

COMMON part: Significant existing and future workload. DLT360 is a wider project initially funded in Fund6, and greatly supported by at least 5 proposals in Fund7, for a total funding so far of 85.000 USD (own calculations), many of them being still ongoing. During Fund8 the team is casting a very wide net with 13 additional proposals across several challenges, for a total funding of 295.000 USD. Onboarding so many projects so quickly can potentially lead to: too much workload, overlapping deadlines, increased risks of under-delivering, inability to distinguish added value of one project versus another, unnecessary stress and a lack of focus on and core scope and competencies. Future iterations that can bring comfort to these worries will of course be highly appreciated. 

COMMON part: ALL of the 13 projects have overhead items included in the budget (project management, social media, back office, etc.) consuming an overall 30-40% of each budget (an educated guess let’s call it). I think there was a missed opportunity there in terms of gathering all overheads under one roof and simplifying the budgets for all proposals by keeping them strict for core-activities.

Specific part: project would comprise basic research by senior & junior contributors and various meetings & discussions including travel.  For budget core-work rates are 80 USD/hour. Core research + meetings take up 60% of the budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
COMMON part: Existing track record. DLT360 projects are interlinked and since there are a number of running projects the team is definitely familiarized with the standard procedures and reporting process of the Catalyst team, so there are very low risks in terms of failing to communicate properly or inability to implement the necessary KPIs. 

COMMON part: The website is a great opportunity for improvement. A concern is the fact that glancing at the DLT360 website, there is no reflection of recent live presentations that were perhaps delivered to the community in Q1 2022. I am aware that it is a work in progress tool, and a very nice-to-have feature would be for such live presentations / slides / supporting materials to be uploaded there as soon as possible and be accessible for the community as an intermediate deliverable until the projects are finalized. Also for the sake of transparency, a user-friendly list of funded (any why not unfunded) proposals would definitely be appreciated, at least by future CAs.  

Specific part: project - specific KPIs are inserted. They include project-specific network growth, no. of industry and consulting partnerships, Whitepaper published.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is not the first time I have read the proposal related to the DLT360 team’s project, and I still appreciate the seriousness and carefulness of the elite members of your team. Each proposal begins with a thorough description of the actual context and reasons why the team's project could help solve the audience’s problem. And this time, the proposal mentions the huge challenges machine and equipment manufacturers face in the context where digital transformation is eroding their OEM business model. The problem is posed, thereby providing a reasonable solution and leading to an overall quality picture is always the way to introduce the remarkable project of the DLT360 team.
Still, I remind you not to repeat the passage about “the need to pack our activities into single projects” twice in the same Impact part. Don't make your proposal more verbose.
f6_assessments.q1: Honestly, I've read this Feasibility part, and it doesn't seem to have changed at all in the proposals related to the overall project of DLT360. I have already commended the team's thorough preparation in other proposals, so I will not elaborate further on the main content of this part. Instead, I have a piece of advice for you. Since I see the 6th item in the detailed plan is annotated “now specific to this project”, I wonder why it doesn't have anything specific to the topic of this proposal. At the very least, if you can name a few typical names in machine and equipment manufacturing that you are aiming to collaborate with in the future, perhaps this part will have a bit of a highlight. This is just my honest advice, and I hope it helps.
f6_assessments.q2: Each small project is part of a bigger picture, with broader goals and implications. Each proposal is a different issue but will be handled similarly and as part of the DLT360’s big picture. So, I can understand why I have to read the content of this Auditability part one more time. Fortunately, you changed the indicator of the first KPI to match this proposal’s theme, which proves your team's professionalism. Just because it's the same solution and the same goal doesn't mean you will forget this proposal’s audience.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal proposes to do extensive research, which will be described in a Whitepaper, with the goal of identifying benefits for these OEMs by detailing future Metaverse plans. This proposal specifically tackles the enormous issues that machine and equipment manufacturers (also known as OEMs) confront. Through this project, the proposers will study future strategies and specific prospects for the machine and equipment manufacturing business. The concept is excellent and well connected with the problem. Also, the project's concept and constructs appear to be well-thought-out. Furthermore, a clear and well-explained description of how it works, as well as the desire to implement it, helps people understand what is going on and define how and why they want to participate, which is sensible. However, the proposer should make an attempt to quantify the impact. It may have been stated here how many industry partners and consulting firms are being targeted, as well as the next actions to be taken with them. One further recommendation would be to include more specifics here about the solutions to the probable issues that the team has previously anticipated.
f6_assessments.q1: My trust in the proposal's practicality is great because it is a crucial component of a large project called DLT 360, which has been successfully funded in rounds 6 and 7. To validate what was claimed in the proposal, the proposing team submitted their credentials as well as LinkedIn profiles. Because they are the project's core members, the team is very likely to be well prepared to lead this project to success. Given the time and essential work that will be put into the project, the proposal's budget appears appropriate. The proposal would benefit from clarification on the prizes and how they would be distributed. The plan for implementing the solution is straightforward and well-described, but there are no dates associated with each stage other than "specific key-activities - all during Q3 / 2022." It's hard to assess this for someone who doesn't deal with it directly, so more information would have been helpful. The plan should outline when the aforementioned tasks will be achieved. However, given the data and information provided in the proposal, it seems clear that the proposer will be diligent in their work on this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a hazy timeline, which makes it difficult for the community to understand some aspects of the development process. I would have loved a little more clarity in the various milestones that tell the reader what it hopes to achieve in what period. Several KPIs are presented in a systematic and chronological manner, but it would be useful to offer more detail on each KPI here. It is possible that adding a few numbers would improve the proposal's clarity. There should also be some links to social channels incorporated so that the community can track the project's progress. I disagree that the idea provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
"This proposal will bring detailed research about challenges faced by machine & equipment manufacturers to help find benefits for OEM's by future Metaverse strategies. This proposal is a part of DLT360 business with many other fields that the team also funded and executed since fund 6. In the scope of this proposal, with the big gap between innovators in the industry to blockchain development, the team will cooperate with large vendors in the industry to investigate future strategies and specific opportunities. Then they will publish this research into a whitepaper to help businesses in this industry to advance their future. 
The team provides very detailed information about the industry context and the purpose of this proposal. Moreover, the proposer also provides the info of the bigger project of this proposal and shows how it addresses the challenge. It will make a strong impact on machine and equipment manufacturing companies that I believe can change their future development strategy, business model, and some way to solve the past hard problems that when blockchain technology did not exist yet.  "
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer did show clearly their business model in the proposal with detail of its 5 sections that I think can help to sure that they're really focused and determined on this project. Besides the roadmap with simple outlines but enough to understand what they will do, the proposer also provides a very detailed explanation about the budget break-down and I believe that it's suitable with their business model and roadmap above. Moreover, the information about the team and their previous funded proposals can help us give them a high rate of feasibility for this proposal. I believe that they can make the task in the scope of this proposal be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: The community can track their progress of not only this proposal but also whole their project parts with their MIRO environment. Moreover, they provide a KPIs list for the activities during Q3 of 2022 that is clear, detailed, and related to their main mission above. This project will have a huge impact on the industry, and the team has good awareness about that that we can see through their metrics and outputs they focus on the road to succeed this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a fantastic idea that focuses on summarizing a comprehensive study in the form of a whitepaper, with the goal of identifying benefits for these OEMs by laying out future Metaverse strategies. Some factors to consider in terms of impact are as follows:
To begin, the proposer identifies an appropriate problem within the challenge that must be solved and analyzes it with rationale. He/she shows a solid comprehension of the subject under discussion. The issue highlighted demonstrates the genuineness and urgency with which it must be resolved in order to attain the challenge's aims in particular, as well as the ecosystem's overall goals. Furthermore, the proposed solution is well-defined. It demonstrates the possibilities of bringing value to the Cardano ecosystem with a clear short- and long-term impact. Additionally, the proposer specifies the possibilities of scaling in order to solve future challenges.
Finally, I agree that this idea will have a significant impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are a few points to consider in terms of feasibility, including:
First and foremost, this team description is sufficiently explained and offered for comprehension to prove appropriate competence and expertise for implementation, as well as references/proof (documents/links, etc.) for verification. Furthermore, as far as I am aware, this team/proposer has a proposal funded in a previous fund. The purpose of this plan is clear and practical, with a detailed roadmap, some logical, quantifiable KPIs/metrics, and a budget breakdown for assessing the implementation process in detail. Finally, the risk is clearly described, with some mitigation and a further description of how effective those mitigations would be; this demonstrates that the proposer has given careful consideration to and a realistic vision of what may occur during the implementation of this proposal.
As a result, based on the information given, I am strongly convinced of this proposal's feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are a few points to consider when it comes to the auditability of this plan, including:
First and foremost, as can be observed, this team profile is sufficiently presented and explained for comprehension, with sufficient reference/proof (documents/links, etc.) for verification. Second, the roadmap is supplied and defined in detail. The proposer(s) select some measurable KPI/metrics to assess the proposal's success, including: KPI 1 - Number of participating (major) industrial and consultancy partners; KPI 2 - Size of our machine & equipment manufacturing-related content-contributor network (number),.... The budget for this proposal contains a clear cost item structure and detailed explanations of the calculation basis [number of employees, working hours, labor price, etc.].
Based on the evidence supplied, I strongly agree with the auditability of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is reasonably aligned with the challenge. It proposes to conduct research on the needs of machine and equipment manufacturers, and how blockchain could help them. Altough the challenge brief has a more practical tone, I think this research could be considered to be aligned. Impact on Cardano is long-term, in the best-case scenario, and difficult to quantify, but raising awareness of blockchain technology in this specific industry should have a positive impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team should be more than capable of successfully completing the project, there is a senior leader (overlooking 18 proposals just in this Fund), a  senior industry expert, two people for comunication and project management, and several students. This team compositions suggests the bulk of the work would be on the students, and with that in mind, the hourly rates seem quite high ($80/h for basic research, or technical writing, vs a mean hourly rate for a reseacher in Malta below $20/h according to salaryexpert)
The proposed research would require engaging industry providers and clients, which would normally be a difficult, but the experience of the senior members of the team provide, in my view, enough confidence that they will be able to do it.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proposer is experienced in the Catalyst process, and already knows what is expected of them.
KPIs are appropriate for the kind of work being done, I find particularly relevant the number of industry partnerships.
Note to vCAs: The auditability section of this proposal is identical of that of other proposal of the same team ('CPG Brands and Metaverse') for the same challenge. My reviews are also identical.
